oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Home Safety Tips for Annual Safety Field Day, May 10, 1956, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1956, Vol. 2 p.156
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of signs giving home safety tips for the eighth annual Safety Field Day held May 10, 1956. Sponsored by the Nashville Council of Parent-Teachers Associations and the City Beautiful Commission. Taken by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1956. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
